title: Sandbox R code
text:
This Quarto website was rendered on GitHub 2024-02-18 13:03:38 at UTC time.
In the following I test R code to:

Read a public shared googlesheet from Google Drive ✅
Read data from an external API ✅
Read a googlesheet from private Google Drive
Download and read a file (.rds or .xlsx) from private Google Drive
Write and upload a file (.rds) to private Google Drive


Read a public shared googlesheet from Google Drive

library(googlesheets4)
library(gt)

googlesheets4::gs4_deauth()     # Without auth

spreadsheet_url <- "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1dnzTx2TIxk-QpoWNz08Jr_e4F2rZ4mDBgphzq9lwdYM/edit?usp=drive_link"
datatable <- googlesheets4::read_sheet(spreadsheet_url, range = "Ark1!A1:D5")

# datatable |> write_rds("datatable.rds")  # NOT TESTED write and save a file (.rds) to my GitHub repository
datatable |> gt()                        # print my datatable

Read data from an external API: The Star Wars API

library(httr2)
library(tidyr)
library(gt)

resp_json <- 
  httr2::request("https://swapi.dev/api/people/") |>
  httr2::req_perform() |>
  httr2::resp_body_json(simplifyVector = TRUE)

name_people <- 
  resp_json$results$name |>  tidyr::as_tibble()
name_people |> gt()








value

Obi-Wan Kenobi









Read a googlesheet from private Google Drive

library(googledrive)
library(googlesheets4)
library(dplyr)
library(gt)


# Google Authentication
googledrive::drive_auth(
  scopes = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.readonly")
gs4_auth(token = drive_token())

# Get Google Sheet ID
ss <- googledrive::drive_get("hv8_planter_sheet")

# ss can be url???
# Read data from Google Sheet
data <- googlesheets4::read_sheet(ss, sheet = "content")

data |> gt()

title: About
text:
Here is my Workflow for a Quarto website using GitHub Pages and GitHub Actions.
Workflow - setting things up:

Create Quarto website project with git and renv in RStudio on my Mac.
Commit with Sourcetree ??
Create my new repository on GitHub with usethis::use_github() in RStudio in my R project (My GitHub token used in gitcreds::gitcreds_set() controls which GitHub account is used)
On GitHub in my new repository: main -> View all branches -> Create a branch -> “gh-pages”
Create txt file publish.yaml file in new folders .github/workflows. Copy/paste [complete example of a GitHub Action 1.(https://quarto.org/docs/publishing/github-pages.html#example-knitr-with-renv) into publish.yaml
(notice that I have not rendered locally at all)
Commit with Sourcetree
Push to GitHub in in RStudio
On GitHub in my new repository:

Pages -> Branch -> change from “main” to “gh-pages” and save
Top bar -> Actions, - here I can follow the “pages build and deployment” and then I go to visit the website


Workflow:

Write R code and content in qmd files
Call renv::snapshot() to save the state of your project library in renv.lock
Commit with Sourcetree
Push to GitHub in in RStudio
From here GitHub Actions runs automatically. It

runs the R code
renders the Quarto website
publishes the Quarto website on GitHub Pages


Resources:

Quarto: GitHub Pages, Executing Code
ggnot2 on YouTube: Publish a Quarto project using GitHub Pages+GitHub Actions in 6 minutes (no need to render locally!)
Article: How to Use GitHub Actions with R to Run Code Automatically

title: GitHub Actions
text:
This is a sandbox Quarto website with GitHub Actions to:

run R code within Quarto on Github
publish a Quarto website on GitHub Pages

Use cases:

run R scrips remotely and document when the code has been executed
produce and publish a report automatically on a schedule

With GitHub Actions on GitHub I can:

install Quarto + R and the correct versions of each R package you need (yml file)
render a Quarto project (not render any files locally!) (yml file)
publish a Quarto project on GitHub Pages (yml file)
execute R code and content in qmd files
